text: furgus McIntyre was a man who lived in
two dimensions to fans of science
fiction he was the writer nicknamed
froggy a witty and eloquent author of
numerous books articles and short
stories of great promise an iraq on tour
who dressed like a british Clubman and
claimed to have trotted the globe and
hobnob with famous writers then there
was Fergus gruff disheveled packrat
whose eccentricity stood out among 20th
Avenue in the working-class
Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn this was
an unusual character he was a creative
science fiction writer he was like a
character like a character of one of his
fiction or science fiction stories his
one-bedroom apartment was stuffed with
decades of work and waste including
copies of his own books and articles as
well as many unsold manuscripts and
rejection letters it all became fuel for
a fire he methodically lid On June 25th
to end his life at age 59 it was almost
like something out of one of his stories
I mean at the end it seems like he
really started to lose it and he did
lose it because he better come saved in
an apartment no I'm he put guys flew it
all over the place he lit himself up not
only that but he let the apartment up
along with froggy often told people who
was orphaned by a Scottish family and
raised in an Australian orphanage in
child labour camp but no one really
seems to know his true history he used
the slew of aliases and it took city
officials weeks to even ideas body which
still lies on claim in the Brooklyn
morgue and may be headed for a pauper's
burial in potter's field once the toast
of science fiction circles a darling of
writers conventions all over the world
froggy became increasingly reclusive in
his third-floor apartment which Fire
Department officials likened to the
famous overstuffed Collyer brothers
mansion in Harlem froggy was celebrated
in certain sci-fi circles and his death
was big news among his fans but when I
visited his building after his death to
talk to his neighbors really the only
one who knew the first thing about him
or even that he was a writer was Ben
Maurer he was
he was talking about how he couldn't get
money coming in how he wasn't able to
get work helping he was very depressed
he didn't feel well he was upset about
it upset about family situation upset
about his upbringing the fire was put
out with no other serious injuries but
neighbors were shocked and outraged he
sat in a chair and said crying it to
himself
do you know what kind of mind you had to
have at that moment you had to be
completely destroyed there was a huge
collection of esoteric science fiction
books and journals personal
correspondence ease and jaws full of
notices of unpaid taxes all told it took
a five-man crew two full days to cart
out the contents of apartment c9 and
fill a 20-yard dumpster at the curb
there was how much stuff was in the
apartment I mean you were to go and take

outside he's a real decent gentleman but
when you go behind closed doors that's
what he said you never know a person who

his crib I'm saying but I hope that our
